intro: Collomia parviflora f. boulderensis, commonly known as the Boulder Canyon larkspur, is a subspecies of the larkspur genus native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as slopes and meadows. It has a compact, low-growing habit with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The subspecies is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
